feed.title: I do not support the BIP 148 UASF

entry.title: I do not support the BIP 148 UASF
entry.summary: The email exchange between Erik Aronesty, Gregory Maxwell and Mark Friedenbach on the bitcoin-dev mailing list discusses the potential need for a WTXID commitment as a first effort focus, which would likely require a User Activated Soft Fork (UASF). The discussion also includes debate over the critical design features of a UASF and its necessity to be a grassroots effort. Maxwell expresses disappointment with Friedenbach's public statement against the UASF proposal, arguing that it must be supported by the public but also allowing for personal opinions.
